JobFullDesc: Microsoft Start Experiences team is looking for a strong Principal Program Manager to drive the Whole Page Optimization space. This team is where multitude of content experiences and services are brought together to drive engagement and revenue through UX and ML-based optimization techniques. If you love building ML services at scale and architecting solutions that deliver impact to billions of users on multiple Microsoft products, then this is a role for you. This team is responsible to define and standardize optimization metrics and functions & deliver a scalable platform to help our organizations 50+ teams to optimize their experiences. This role requires strong cross-team collaboration and close partnership with the development team. You will leverage a strong technical background to influence the architecture and deliver interfaces/UX features that drive impact in an agile/robust development cycle. This role requires a deep understanding and passion for A/B metrics and the data science behind them. This role is a great opportunity to make an impact across the Content Services organization, influence leadership and partners, develop solutions for optimizing engagement and revenue and ultimately delight our users with content feed experiences and build a daily habit with billions of user on PC & Mobile.ResponsibilitiesAs a Principal PM in this team, you would be in the driving seat of some of the highly advanced and visible products in Content/Enterprise Content delivery space. Your responsibilities include:Thought leadership: Owning and articulating the strategy and roadmap for your product areas.Ambiguity: Being comfortable with ambiguity and difficult trade-offs and driving clarity across teamsCommunication & Collaboration: Effectively collaborating across org boundaries and Engineering teams.Drive implementation the platform to serve tens of internal teams, deliver the impact to billions of users on multiple Microsoft products. Drive creation of documentation, roadmap, training sessions, internal communication, drive adoption of the WPO platform. Drive for end-results, work with Dev team to track / enforce development process. Data Science: Diving deep into data to help inform product changes and new opportunities while closely partnering with ML and Data scientists.QualificationsRequired Qualifications:Bachelor’s or equivalent in Computer Science Information or a Business-related degree (e.g. core sciences, algorithms, ML/DS, NLP).7+ years of experience working as a Program/Product Manager, Data Scientist or Software Engineer or related functions.2+ years’ experience building scalable data / feature pipeline, modeling platform, and/or designing flexible interface to support customers and partners.2+ years of experience working with large scale data or machine learning projects, & A/B experiments. Preferred Qualifications:Machine Learning: Ability to work closely with machine learning scientists, researchers and software engineers to build effective product solutionData-driven:  History of creative, analytical and critical thinking related to working with large scale data (experience in statistical analysis is a huge plus), experience building or evolving metrics. User empathy:  Ability to write simple, clear scenarios, problem statements, requirements and specifications, based on customer’s perspective.
